Intervention.evidence: randomized 1:1 to thoracic paravertebral block with LB (6.67 mg/mL) or ropivacaine hydrochloride (RH; 0.33%)

Objective.evidence: we investigated the effects of LB in multimodal analgesia after thoracic surgery with paravertebral block

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was opioid consumption within 72 h postoperatively

Number_Randomised.evidence: 102 patients undergoing elective thoracoscopic surgery were randomized 1:1

Number_Analysed.evidence: One patient was excluded due to block failure, leaving 101 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: LB significantly reduced 72-h opioid consumption compared to RH (difference = –181.4 mg; 95% CI: –232.8, –130.0 mg; P < 0.001)

Trial_Registration.evidence: Chinese Clinical Trials Registry Platform (chictr.org.cn): ChiCTR2400091217
